title: [Large-Scale] Blended Course Based on Scholarship of Teaching and Learning (SoTL) for Strengthening Public Administration Practice Competencies: Linking Citizen Participation and Institutional Improvement

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of Public Administration Foundations, Practical Experience, Citizen Participation Systems, and Digital Literacy. Additionally, requires basic understanding of citizen rights and political processes
context.additional_context: Practice-centered design for current professionals to bridge theory-practice gaps. Utilizes digital devices and LMS (Learning Management Systems). Includes project-based learning (PBL) elements for solving community issues. Strengthens discussion sessions to elevate learners' political/social awareness. Specifically includes policy proposal workshops for promoting civic rights and institutional improvements.

learning_goals: Learners analyze current research trends and citizen participation cases in public administration to apply to instructional design, particularly exploring civic rights and institutional improvement strategies

Learners integrate SoTL methodologies with community problem-solving cases to develop field-oriented educational modules, including collaborative learning strategies reflecting political and cultural contexts

Learners design and implement a 2-week engagement-enhancement program (real-time feedback, gamification, collaborative learning) in a blended environment (online+offline) for 50 learners in their 30s at public educational institutions. The program must achieve ≥20% improvement in engagement scores in pre-post surveys, submit a learner rights awareness evaluation (≥7/10 scale) and institutional improvement proposals (≥3 concrete suggestions), while incorporating cultural diversity and civic collaboration systems

Learners propose an evaluation system to measure public administration education effectiveness, including indicators reflecting cultural and political contexts. The system must include social impact metrics such as citizen participation, rights awareness changes, and feasibility of institutional improvement proposals

resources: SoTL (Scholarship of Teaching and Learning) Research Casebook

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
